### `Updating Homebrew...``control + c``^C` > ### `Homebrew` `zsh` ``` $ echo 'export HOMEBREW_NO_AUTO_UPDATE=true' >> ~/.zshrc $ source ~/.zshrc ``` `bash` ``` $ echo 'export HOMEBREW_NO_AUTO_UPDATE=true' >> ~/.bash_profile $ source ~/.bash_profile ``` > ### #### homebrew ``` $ cd "$(brew --repo)" $ git remote set-url origin https://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/brew.git ``` ``` $ cd "$(brew --repo)" $ git remote set-url origin https://github.com/Homebrew/brew.git ``` #### homebrew-core() ``` $ cd "$(brew --repo)/Library/Taps/homebrew/homebrew-core" $ git remote set-url origin https://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/homebrew-core.git ``` ``` $ cd "$(brew --repo)/Library/Taps/homebrew/homebrew-core" $ git remote set-url origin https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core.git ``` #### homebrew-cask(macOS) ``` $ cd "$(brew --repo)"/Library/Taps/homebrew/homebrew-cask $ git remote set-url origin https://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/homebrew-cask.git ``` `"$(brew --repo)"/Library/Taps/homebrew/homebrew-cask` ``` $ cd "$(brew --repo)"/Library/Taps/homebrew/ $ git clone https://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/homebrew-cask.git ``` ``` $ cd "$(brew --repo)"/Library/Taps/homebrew/homebrew-cask $ git remote set-url origin https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask ``` > `brew cask``Application``Launchpad` #### homebrew bottles() `zsh` ``` $ echo 'export HOMEBREW_BOTTLE_DOMAIN=https://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/homebrew-bottles' >> ~/.zshrc $ source ~/.zshrc ``` `bash` ``` $ echo 'export HOMEBREW_BOTTLE_DOMAIN=https://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/homebrew-bottles' >> ~/.bash_profile $ source ~/.bash_profile ``` `HOMEBREW_BOTTLE_DOMAIN` `source` ## Post._content: . ## `hello.c`: ``` #include __attribute__ ((visibility ("default"))) void hello() { printf("Hello World!\n"); } ``` `hello.h`: ``` #ifndef __HELLO__H #define __HELLO__H #ifdef __cplusplus extern "C" { #endif void hello(); #ifdef __cplusplus } #endif #endif ``` `bye.c`: ``` #include void bye() { printf("Bye Bye!\n"); } ``` `bye.h`: ``` #ifndef __BYE__H #define __BYE__H #ifdef __cplusplus extern "C" { #endif void bye(); #ifdef __cplusplus } #endif #endif ``` ## `-fvisibility=hidden`,;`__attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))`: ``` $ gcc -fvisibility=hidden -I. -c hello.c -o hello.o $ gcc -fvisibility=hidden -I. -c bye.c -o bye.o ``` `hello()`,`bye()`. ## `.o``libt.o`: ``` $ ld -r hello.o bye.o -o libt.o ``` ## ``` $ strip --strip-unneeded libt.o ``` ## () ``` $ objcopy --localize-hidden libt.o libt_hidden.o ``` ## ``` $ ar crv libt.a libt_hidden.o ``` ## ### `hello()` `test1.c`: ``` #include "hello.h" int main(void) { hello(); return 0; } ``` ``` $ gcc -I. test1.c -L. -lt -o test $ ./test Hello World! ``` ### `bye()` test2.c ``` #include "bye.h" int main(void) { bye(); return 0; } ``` ``` $ gcc -I. test2.c -L. -lt -o test $ ./test /tmp/ccdaJT7s.o: In function `main': test2.c:(.text+0xa): undefined reference to `bye' collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status ``` ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post.title: Linuxadb devices no permissions
Post._content: Linuxadb[](http://pan.baidu.com/s/1qYhBG2w)*/usr/bin* ---------- ## Linuxadb ``` $ adb devices ``` ``` List of devices attached ???????????? no permissions ``` ## ``` $ sudo vi /etc/udev/rules.d/70-android.rules ``` USB ``` $ lsusb Bus 003 Device 011: ID 1f3a:1002 Onda (unverified) ``` ``` SUBSYSTEM=="usb",ATTRS{idVendor}=="1f3a",ATTRS{idProduct}=="1002", MODE="0666" ``` idvendoridProductusbidID 1f3aidVendor 1002 idProduct ``` $ sudo chmod a+x /etc/udev/rules.d/70-android.rules ``` udev ``` $ sudo /etc/init.d/udev restart ``` ``` $ sudo adb kill-server $ adb devices ``` ``` * daemon not running. starting it now on port 5037 * * daemon started successfully * List of devices attached 20080411 device ``` ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post.title: --hash-style
Post._content: `--hash-style` ----- ## ``` dlopen failed: empty/missing DT_HASH in "libxxx.so" (built with --hash-style=gnu?) ``` ## `` - `DT_HASH` ``` ELF Sections ``` - `--hash-style=style`( `man ld`) ``` Set the type of linker's hash table(s). style can be either "sysv" for classic ELF ".hash" section, "gnu" for new style GNU ".gnu.hash" section or "both" for both the classic ELF ".hash" and new style GNU ".gnu.hash" hash tables. The default is "sysv". ``` ## `--hash-style=style` `style` `sysv``gnu``both` - `gcc -Wl,--hash-style=sysv` ``` $ readelf -S libxxx.so | grep "hash" [ 4] .hash HASH 0000000000003120 00003120 ``` - `gcc -Wl,--hash-style=gnu` ``` $ readelf -S libxxx.so | grep "hash" [ 4] .gnu.hash GNU_HASH 0000000000003120 00003120 ``` - `gcc -Wl,--hash-style=both` ``` $ readelf -S libxxx.so | grep "hash" [ 4] .gnu.hash GNU_HASH 0000000000003120 00003120 [ 5] .hash HASH 00000000000035f8 000035f8 ``` > `-Wl` `Sections Name` > `.gnu.hash` `hash` `hash` `50%` [https://blogs.oracle.com/solaris/gnu-hash-elf-sections-v2](https://blogs.oracle.com/solaris/gnu-hash-elf-sections-v2) ## ``` libxxx.so DT_HASH --hash-style=gnu ? ``` `--hash-style=gnu` `Section Name` `.gnu.hash` `.hash` `Makefile` ``` $ gcc -dumpspecs | grep "hash" ... --hash-style=gnu ... ``` > `-dumpspecs` `--hash-style` `gnu` ## `--hash-style` `gnu` `--hash-style` `gnu` ## `--hash-style` `both` ``` LDFLAGS += -Wl,--hash-style=both ``` ## - [Only one --hash-style in embedded Linux. Why?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11741816/only-one-hash-style-in-embedded-linux-why) - [Binaries built on RHEL5 or FC6 do not work on RHEL4 or FC5!](https://sites.google.com/site/avinesh/binaryincompatibilitybetweenrhel4andrhel) - [Android NDK UnsatisfiedLinkError: dlopen failed: empty/missing DT_HASH](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28638809/android-ndk-unsatisfiedlinkerror-dlopen-failed-empty-missing-dt-hash) - [Trouble understanding gcc linker options](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42068271/trouble-understanding-gcc-linker-options) ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post._content: `Json``{}``object``[]``array` ## `API``json``key``decode``encode``key` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":{}} ``` `cjson``table``object``Lua`(`C/C++, Java`) ## ### `encode_empty_table_as_object` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} cjson.encode_empty_table_as_object(false) local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ### `dkjson` ```lua local dkjson = require('dkjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} local str = dkjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ### `metatable``table``array` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} setmetatable(raw.list, cjson.empty_array_mt) local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ## Reference - [ array object](https://moonbingbing.gitbooks.io/openresty-best-practices/content/json/array_or_object.html) - [lua CJSONtable](http://blog.csdn.net/ljfrocky/article/details/53034932?_t=t) - [openresty/lua-cjson](https://github.com/openresty/lua-cjson) ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post._content: **`GCC``always_inline`** ----- **`GCC``always_inline`** ```c #include inline void say(void) { printf("Hello, World\n"); } int main(void) { say(); return 0; } ``` `-O3` ```bash $ gcc -O3 -o test_O3.o -c test.c $ g++ test_O3.o -o test_O3 $ ./test_O3 Hello, World ``` `-O0``say` ```bash $ gcc -O0 -o test_O0.o -c test.c $ g++ test_O0.o -o test_O0 test_O0.o: In function `main': test.c:(.text+0x5): undefined reference to `say' collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status ``` `test_O0.o``test_O3.o` ```bash $ readelf -s test_O0.o Symbol table '.symtab' contains 10 entries: Num: Value Size Type Bind Vis Ndx Name 0: 0000000000000000 0 NOTYPE LOCAL DEFAULT UND 1: 0000000000000000 0 FILE LOCAL DEFAULT ABS test.c 2: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 1 3: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 3 4: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 4 5: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 6 6: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 7 7: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 5 8: 0000000000000000 16 FUNC GLOBAL DEFAULT 1 main 9: 0000000000000000 0 NOTYPE GLOBAL DEFAULT UND say ``` ```bash $ readelf -s test_O3.o Symbol table '.symtab' contains 13 entries: Num: Value Size Type Bind Vis Ndx Name 0: 0000000000000000 0 NOTYPE LOCAL DEFAULT UND 1: 0000000000000000 0 FILE LOCAL DEFAULT ABS test.c 2: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 1 3: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 2 4: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 3 5: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 4 6: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 5 7: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 6 8: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 9 9: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 10 10: 0000000000000000 0 SECTION LOCAL DEFAULT 8 11: 0000000000000000 21 FUNC GLOBAL DEFAULT 6 main 12: 0000000000000000 0 NOTYPE GLOBAL DEFAULT UND puts ``` `test_O0.o``inline``say``inline` `say``always_inline` ```c #include __attribute__((always_inline)) inline void say(void) { printf("Hello, World\n"); } int main(void) { say(); return 0; } ``` `-O0``ok` ```bash $ gcc -O0 -o test.o -c test.c $ gcc -O0 -o test_O0_2.o -c test.c $ g++ test_O0_2.o -o test_O0_2 $ ./test_O0_2 Hello, World ``` ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post.title: Linuxcore
Post._content: `code` ------ ## core `Linux``core``ELF` ## core ### 1. `core` ``` $ ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) 0 # ... ``` 2. ``` ulimit -c unlimited ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) unlimited ... ``` 3. `core``blocks``1 block=512 bytes` ``` $ ulimit -c 1024 $ ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) 1024 ... ``` 4. ``` ulimit -c 0 ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) 0 ... ``` > `core``/etc/profile` ### `core` ``` echo /MyCoreDumpDir/core.%e.%p > /proc/sys/kernel/core_pattern ``` ``` %p - insert pid into filename # pid %u - insert current uid into filename # uid %g - insert current gid into filename # gid %s - insert signal that caused the coredump into the filename # core %t - insert UNIX time that the coredump occurred into filename # core unix %h - insert hostname where the coredump happened into filename # %e - insert coredumping executable name into filename # ``` > `/proc/sys/kernel/core_uses_pid``%p`,`core``pid` ### `gdb``core``-g` ``` $ gdb a.out ... (gdb) core-file core ... (gdb) bt ... ``` `PC``core``gdb``gdb` ``` $ xxx-xxx-gdb a.out ... (gdb) solib-search-path xxx.so:xxx.so ... (gdb) core-file core ... (gdb) bt ... ``` ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post.title: LinuxC
Post._content: LinuxC,[](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ/DogFood/tree/master/Make/example-lib). ## welcome.c: ``` #include #include"welcome.h" void welcome() { printf("welcome to my code world!\n"); } ``` > ,. welcome.h: ``` #ifndef _WELCOME_H #define _WELCOME_H void welcome(); #endif ``` > . ## ,() ,,,,, . ## : ``` $ gcc -Wall -O2 -fPIC -I./ -c -o welcome.o welcome.c $ ar crv libwelcome.a welcome.o ``` ar: ``` -r objfile -x objfile -t -d objfile -s -v -c ``` test-sta.c: ``` #include int main(void) { welcome(); return 0; } ``` : ``` $ gcc test-sta.c -o test-sta ./libwelcome.a ``` : ``` $ ./test-sta $ welcome to my code world! ``` ## : ``` $ gcc -o2 -fPIC -shared welcome.c -o libwelcome.so or $ gcc -o2 -fPIC -c welcome.c $ gcc -shared -o libwelcome.so welcome.o ``` : - fPIC : ,. - shared : . ### () test-implicit.c: ``` #include int main() { welcome(); return 0; } ``` > ,. : ``` $ gcc -o2 -Wall -L. -lwelcome test-implicit.c -o test-implicit ``` `test-implicit`,`libwelcome.so`: ``` $ ldd test-implicit linux-vdso.so.1 => (0x00007f0902951000) libwelcome.so => ./libwelcome.so (0x00007f090274f000) libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x0000003548600000) libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x000000353de00000) libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x0000003548200000) libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x000000353da00000) /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000000353d600000) ``` ,: ``` $ ./test-implicit $ ./test-implicit: error while loading shared libraries: libwelcome.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory ``` : ``` # $ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$(pwd):$LD_LIBRARY_PATH # $ ln -s ./libwelcome.so /usr/lib # /etc/ld.so.conf $ sudo echo $(pwd) >> /etc/ld.so.conf $ sudo ldconfig ``` : ``` $ ./test-implicit $ welcome to my code world! ``` ### () test-explicit.c: ``` #include #include #define LIB "./libwelcome.so" int main(void) { /* * RTLD_NOW * RTLD_LAZYdlsym() */ void *dl = dlopen(LIB,RTLD_LAZY); // if (dl == NULL) fprintf(stderr,"Error:failed to load libary.\n"); char *error = dlerror(); // if (error != NULL) { fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error); return -1; } void (*func)() = dlsym(dl,"welcome"); // error = dlerror(); // if (error != NULL) { fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error); return -1; } func(); // dlclose(dl); // error = dlerror(); // if (error != NULL) { fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error); return -1; } return 0; } ``` : ``` $ gcc -ldl test-explicit.c -o test-explicit ``` `test-explicit`,`libwelcome.so`: ``` $ ldd test-explicit linux-vdso.so.1 => (0x00007ffed89e5000) libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x000000353e600000) libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x0000003548600000) libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x000000353de00000) libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x0000003548200000) libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x000000353da00000) /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000000353d600000) ``` : ``` $ ./test-explicit $ welcome to my code world! ``` > : . ## Reference - [Linux](http://blog.csdn.net/star_xiong/article/details/17301191) - [Linux](http://hbprotoss.github.io/posts/linuxxia-bian-yi-lian-jie-dong-tai-ku.html) - [Linux(.so)(.a)](http://blog.csdn.net/felixit0120/article/details/7652907) ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post._content: `C/C++``Gcov` ## ### `Gcov``GCC``GCC` ### #### BB #### ARC `BB``BB``ARC`,`BB``ARC` #### `BB``BB``BB``ARC``BB``BB``ARC``ARC``BB``ARC``BB``ARC` ### 3~4`*.s` ## ### `say.c`: ``` #include int say(char *what) { printf("------ %s\n", what); return 0; } ``` `main.c` ``` #include extern int say(const char *); int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) { if (argv[1]) { say("hello"); } else { say("bye"); } return 0; } ``` `-fprofile-arcs -ftest-coverage -fPIC``*.gcno` ``` $ gcc -fprofile-arcs -ftest-coverage -fPIC -O0 say.c main.c $ ls a.out main.c main.gcno say.c say.gcno ``` ### `*.gcda``*.o``*.c`: ``` $ ./a.out ------ bye $ ls a.out main.c main.gcda main.gcno say.c say.gcda say.gcno ``` `GCOV_PREFIX=/xxx/xxx``GCOV_PREFIX_STRIP=x``GCOV_PREFIX_STRIP``0``/a/b/c/d.c``GCOV_PREFIX_STRIP=2``c/d.c``GCOV_PREFIX=/e/f``.gcda``/e/f/c/d.gcda` ### `*.gcov` ``` $ gcov -a main.c File 'main.c' Lines Post._content: `RPATH` `RUNPATH` ----- # RPATHRUNPATH ## `main.c` ```c #include "a.h" int main() { a(); return 0; } ``` `libA.so` ```c // a.c #include "b.h" void a() { b(); } ``` ```c // a.h void a(); ``` `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` ```bash $ gcc -fPIC -shared a.c -I. -L. -lB -o libA.so ``` `libB.so` ```c // b.c #include void b() { printf("Hello, World\n"); } ``` ```c // b.h void b(); ``` `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` ```bash $ gcc -fPIC -shared -I. b.c -o libB.so ``` > **`main` -> `a` -> `b`** ## 1. `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` ```bash $ gcc -I. -o main main.c -Wl,--rpath,. -L. -lA -lB ``` 2. `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` **** ```bash $ ./main Hello, World ``` 3. `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` **** ```bash $ ./main ./main: error while loading shared libraries: libB.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory ``` > `./main` `libB.so` ## ### `libA.so` `libB.so` `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` `libA.so` `libB.so` `libA.so` `libB.so` ### **`LD_DEBUG`** `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` ```bash $ LD_DEBUG=libs ./main [16:37:15] 22331: find library=libA.so [0]; searching 22331: search path=./tls/x86_64:./tls:./x86_64:. (RPATH from file ./main) ...... 22331: trying file=./libA.so ...... 22331: find library=libB.so [0]; searching 22331: search path=./tls/x86_64:./tls:./x86_64:. (RPATH from file ./main) ...... 22331: trying file=./libB.so ...... ``` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` ```bash $ LD_DEBUG=libs ./main 33218: find library=libA.so [0]; searching 33218: search path=./tls/haswell/x86_64:./tls/haswell:./tls/x86_64:./tls:./haswell/x86_64:./haswell:./x86_64:. (RUNPATH from file ./main) ...... 33218: trying file=./libA.so ...... 33218: find library=libB.so [0]; searching 33218: search cache=/etc/ld.so.cache 33218: search path=/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:/lib/tls/haswell/x86_64:/lib/tls/haswell:/lib/tls/x86_64:/lib/tls:/lib/haswell/x86_64:/lib/haswell:/lib/x86_64:/lib:/usr/lib/tls/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/tls/haswell:/usr/lib/tls/x86_64:/usr/lib/tls:/usr/lib/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/haswell:/usr/lib/x86_64:/usr/lib (system search path) ...... ./main: error while loading shared libraries: libB.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory ``` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` `libA.so` `libB.so` `libB.so` `system search path` `./` `libB.so` > > 1. `LD_LIBRARY_PATH``-L` `-rpath` > 1. `/etc/ld.so.cache` > 1. `/usr/lib``/lib` ### RPATHRUNPATH `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` `-rpath` `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` ```bash $ readelf -d main Dynamic section at offset 0xe08 contains 26 entries: Tag Type Name/Value 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libA.so] 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libc.so.6] 0x000000000000000f (RPATH) Library rpath: [.] $ readelf -d libA.so Dynamic section at offset 0xe08 contains 25 entries: Tag Type Name/Value 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libB.so] 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libc.so.6] $ readelf -d libB.so Dynamic section at offset 0xe18 contains 24 entries: Tag Type Name/Value 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libc.so.6] ``` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` ```bash $ readelf -d main Dynamic section at offset 0x2da8 contains 29 entries: Tag Type Name/Value 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libA.so] 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libc.so.6] 0x000000000000001d (RUNPATH) Library runpath: [.] $ readelf -d libA.so Dynamic section at offset 0xe08 contains 25 entries: Tag Type Name/Value 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libB.so] 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libc.so.6] $ readelf -d libB.so Dynamic section at offset 0xe18 contains 24 entries: Tag Type Name/Value 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libc.so.6] ``` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` `RPATH` `RUNPATH` `-rpath` > `main` -> `libA.so` -> `libB.so` ** `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0) ` `-rpath` `RUNPATH` `RPATH` `RUNPATH` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` `libA.so` `libB.so` ** > `gcc version >= 7.5.0``-rpath` ## ### LD_LIBRARY_PATH `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` **** ```bash $ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:./libs ``` 1. `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` 1. `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` ### --disable-new-dtags `-Wl,--disable-new-dtags` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` ```bash $ gcc -I. -o main main.c -Wl,--disable-new-dtags,--rpath,. -L. -lA -lB ``` ```bash $ ./main Hello, World $ readelf -d main Dynamic section at offset 0x2da8 contains 29 entries: Tag Type Name/Value 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libA.so] 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED) Shared library: [libc.so.6] 0x000000000000000f (RPATH) Library rpath: [.] ``` `main` `RUNPATH` `RPATH` `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` > `-Wl,--enable-new-dtags` ``` --enable-new-dtags --disable-new-dtags This linker can create the new dynamic tags in ELF. But the older ELF systems may not understand them. If you specify --enable-new-dtags, the new dynamic tags will be created as needed and older dynamic tags will be omitted. If you specify --disable-new-dtags, no new dynamic tags will be created. By default, the new dynamic tags are not created. Note that those options are only available for ELF systems. ``` ## - [How to set RPATH and RUNPATH with GCC/LD?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52018092/how-to-set-rpath-and-runpath-with-gcc-ld) - [use RPATH but not RUNPATH?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7967848/use-rpath-but-not-runpath) ----- - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[https://www.answerywj.com](https://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[AnSwEr](https://weibo.com/1783591593)

Post._content: [Git](http://answerywj.com/2016/08/28/Git%E9%80%9F%E6%9F%A5%E6%89%8B%E5%86%8C/) ---------- ## git v2.1.0v1.8[](https://git-scm.com/downloads) git ``` $ git --version ``` ``git config`` ``` --system : , /etc/gitconfig . --global : , ~/.gitconfig . --local : , repo/.git/config ,default. ``` global,git ``` $ git config --global --unset user.name $ git config --global --unset user.email ``` .gitlabgithub,local ``` $ git config --local user.name "username" $ git config --local user.email "email" ``` githttpsssh.httpssshgit SSH: ``` $ ls ~/.ssh ``` ,`id_rsa.pub`githubSSH keys,: ``` $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@youremail.com" ``` sshssh ``` $ ssh -T git@github.com Hi! Youve successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not provide shell access. ``` https, , ``` $ git config --global http.sslverify false $ git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout=3600' ``` diffmerge, linuxmelddiffuse ``` $ git config --global diff.tool meld $ git config --global merge.tool meld ``` ,, `pull/push` ``` $ git config --global credential.helper store # , ``` , ``` $ git config --global color.ui.true ``` ``` $ git config --global alias checkout co ``` > ``checkout````co`` , ``` $ git config --local --list $ git config --global --list $ git config --system --list ``` ## ![](git-work-flow.jpg) ,``.git``,stageindexGitmastermasterHEAD 1. ``git add`` 2. ``git commit`` GitGitmastergit commitmaster ## ``` $ git clone git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git ``` ``` $ cd repo $ git init $ git remote add origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git ``` > ``origin````git`` : ``` $ git add $ git add . # $ git add * # ``` : ``` $ git commit -m "commit message" $ git commit -am "commit message" ``` > ``commit message``[ Git Commit 7 ](http://blog.jobbole.com/92713/) > ``am``, ``` $ git push -u origin ``` > ``-u``,``git pull``.[](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5697750/what-exactly-does-the-u-do-git-push-u-origin-master-vs-git-push-origin-ma) ``` $ git remote -v origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push) origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch) ``` fork ``` # $ git remote add upstream git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git $ git remote -v origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push) origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch) upstream git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push) upstream git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch) $ git fetch upstream $ git difftool upstream/master $ git merge upstream/master $ git mergetool ``` git``submodule````subtree``[subtree](http://aoxuis.me/post/2013-08-06-git-subtree) ``` # $ git remote add -f $ git subtree add --prefix= --squash # subtree $ git subtree pull --prefix= --squash # subtree $ git subtree push --prefix= ``` ## ``` $ git tag ``` ``` $ git tag -a -m "tag message" # commit $ git tag -a -m "tag message" # commit ``` ``` $ git push origin # $ git push origin --tags # ``` ``` $ git tag -d # $ git push origin :refs/tags/ # ``` ## : ``` $ git status ``` ``` $ git difftool $ git mergetool ``` : ``` $ git log $ git log --pretty=oneline #commit id commit message ``` ``Tracked files`` ``` $ git checkout -- ``` ``Untracked files`` ``` ##### # n: # f:Untracked # d:Untracked # x:gitignoreUntracked ##### git clean -nfd git clean -fd ``` (`git commit`)(`git add`) ``` $ git reset --mixed HEAD^ # --mixed $ git reset HEAD^ ``` (`git commit`)(`git add`) ``` $ git reset --soft HEAD^ ``` (`git commit`)(`git add`)(``Untracked files``)`` ``` $ git reset --hard ``` > `HEAD```HEAD^````HEAD^^``100``HEAD~100`` ``commit id`` ``` $ git reflog ``` ``` $ git rm ``` ``push`` ``` $ git revert ``` > ``revert````commit````commit``;``reset````commit````push`` ## ``*`` ``` $ git branch -a ``` ``` $ git branch ``` ``` $ git checkout -b ``` ``` $ git branch $ git checkout # ``` ``` $ git push -u origin or $ git push --set-upstream origin ``` ``` $ git branch -d ``` > ``-D`` () ``` $ git push origin --delete $ git push origin -d $ git push origin : ``` ``` $ git remote prune origin ``` > remote ``` $ git branch --set-upstream origin/branch ``` ``` $ git checkout -b ``` ``git pull`` ``` # , origin/ $ git fetch origin # $ git difftool origin/ # $ git merge origin/ # mergetool $ git mergetool ``` ``master`` ``` $ git fetch origin master $ git difftool origin/master $ git merge origin/master $ git mergetool ``` ``: ``` $ git branch -a --contains ``` ## ,,,.: ``` $ git stash save "message" ``` : ``` $ git stash list ``` : ``` $ git stash pop [--index] [stash@{num}] or $ git stash apply [--index] [stash@{num}]# . ``` > ``--index``,;``num``,. : ``` $ git stash drop [stash@{num}] # $ git stash clear # ``` ## ### ``` $ git branch -d $ git tag -d $ git remote prune origin $ git pull ``` ### - `git` ``` $ git count-objects -v $ du -sh .git ``` - `ID` ``` $ git verify-pack -v .git/objects/pack/*.idx | sort -k 3 -n | tail -10 ``` > `I`D`blob``tree`10 - `ID` ``` $ git rev-list --objects --all | grep "$(git verify-pack -v .git/objects/pack/*.idx | sort -k 3 -n | tail -10 | awk '{print$1}')" ``` - ``` $ git filter-branch --tree-filter 'rm -rf xxx' HEAD --all $ git pull ``` - `.git`: ``` $ git gc --prune=now ``` >tips: `push``git``gc``loose object` ### git,[](http://www.oschina.net/news/71365/git-annex-lfs-bigfiles-fat-media-bigstore-sym) ## ``git status````Untracked`` ### ``.gitignore`` ``` tmp/ # tmp *.ini # ini !data/ #data ``` ### ``.gitignore_global````.gitignore````~/.gitconfig`` ``` [core] excludesfile = ~/.gitignore_global ``` `Tracked`,`Untracked` ``` $ git rm -r --cached . ``` > [``.gitignore``](https://github.com/github/gitignore) ## ### ``` $ git rebase -i [git-hash| head~n] ``` > `git-hash``rebase``commit``hash``head~n``HEAD``n``commit` ### ``` git filter-branch --commit-filter ' if [ "$GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL" = "xxx@localhost" ]; then GIT_AUTHOR_NAME="xxx"; GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL="xxx@example.com"; git commit-tree "$@"; else git commit-tree "$@"; fi' HEAD --all ``` ## ``` $ git --help ``` ## Reference 1. [git](http://www.liaoxuefeng.com/wiki/0013739516305929606dd18361248578c67b8067c8c017b000) 2. [Git](http://www.ruanyifeng.com/blog/2015/12/git-cheat-sheet.html) 3. Post._content: [Git](https://answerywj.com/2019/02/12/git-help-v2/) ----- ## Git ### > `Git`[https://git-scm.com/downloads](https://git-scm.com/downloads)`v1.8` `Git` ``` $ git --version ``` ### `Git` - `--system` `/etc/gitconfig` - `--global` `~/.gitconfig` - `--local` `[repo]/.git/config`** `global``Git` ``` $ git config --global --unset user.name $ git config --global --unset user.email ``` ``` $ git config --local user.name "username" $ git config --local user.email "email" ``` `Git` ``` $ git config --global credential.helper store ``` > ``` $ git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout=3600' ``` `v2.13.0` - `.gitconfig` `includeIf` ```diff - [user] - name = weijie.yuan - email = weijie.yuan@gitlab.com + [includeIf "gitdir:~/github/"] + path = .gitconfig-github + [includeIf "gitdir:~/gitlab/"] + path = .gitconfig-gitlab ``` - `path` `.gitconfig-github` `.gitconfig-gitlab` ``` $ vi .gitconfig-github [user] name = weijie.yuan email = weijie.yuan@github.com $ vi .gitconfig-gitlab [user] name = weijie.yuan email = weijie.yuan@gitlab.com ``` `includeIf` - `.gitconfig` `includeIf` `path` `/` - `.gitconfig` `user` - `.gitconfig` `includeIf` ### `Git``SSH``HTTPS``SSH``Git``HTTPS` #### SSH `SSH``id_rsa.pub``Git``SSH keys` ``` $ ls ~/.ssh ``` - `Git` ``` $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@youremail.com" ``` - `Git` ``` $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@youremail.com" -f "git1_id_rsa" $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@youremail.com" -f "git2_id_rsa" $ cp git1_id_rsa* ~/.ssh/ $ cp git2_id_rsa* ~/.ssh/ # $ vi ~/.ssh/config # git1 Host git1.com HostName git1.com PreferredAuthentications publickey IdentityFile ~/.ssh/git1_id_rsa # git2 Host git2.com HostName git2.com PreferredAuthentications publickey IdentityFile ~/.ssh/git2_id_rsa ``` `id_rsa.pub``Git``SSH keys`ssh ``` $ ssh -T git@github.com Hi! Youve successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not provide shell access. ``` > ``` $ git clone git@git.server:test.git ``` #### HTTPS `ssl` ``` $ git config --global http.sslverify false ``` ``` $ git clone https://git.server/test.git ``` #### ``` $ git remote -v ``` `https``ssh` ``` git remote set-url origin git@domain:username/ProjectName.git ``` `ssh``https` ``` git remote set-url origin https://domain/username/ProjectName.git ``` ### `diff``merge``git difftool --tool-help``meld` - `Linux` or `MacOS` ``` $ git config --global diff.tool meld $ git config --global merge.tool meld ``` - `Windows` ``` > git config --global diff.tool meld > git config --global merge.tool meld > git config --global difftool.bc3.path 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\Meld.exe' > git config --global mergetool.meld.path 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\Meld.exe' > git config --global difftool.meld.path 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\Meld.exe' ``` ``` $ git config --global color.ui.true ``` `Git` ``` $ git config --global alias checkout co ``` > `checkout``co` ### ``` $ git config --local --list $ git config --global --list $ git config --system --list ``` ## ![](git-work-flow.jpg) `.git``stage``index``Git``master``master``HEAD` 1. `git add` 2. `git commit` ## ``` $ git clone git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git ``` ``` $ cd repo $ git init $ git remote add origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git ``` > `origin``git` ``` $ git add $ git add . # $ git add * # ``` ``` $ git commit -m "commit message" $ git commit -am "commit message" # am ``` > ``commit message``[ Git Commit 7 ](http://blog.jobbole.com/92713/) ``` $ git push -u origin ``` > ``-u``,``git pull``.[](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5697750/what-exactly-does-the-u-do-git-push-u-origin-master-vs-git-push-origin-ma) ``` $ git remote -v origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push) origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch) ``` ``` $ git remote add upstream git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git ``` `fork` ``` $ git remote -v origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push) origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch) upstream git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push) upstream git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch) $ git fetch upstream $ git difftool upstream/master $ git merge upstream/master $ git mergetool ``` `Git```submodule````subtree``[subtree](http://aoxuis.me/post/2013-08-06-git-subtree) ``` # $ git remote add -f $ git subtree add --prefix= --squash # subtree $ git subtree pull --prefix= --squash # subtree $ git subtree push --prefix= ``` ## ``*`` ``` $ git branch -a ``` ``` $ git branch ``` ``` $ git checkout -b ``` ``` $ git branch $ git checkout # ``` ``` $ git push -u origin or $ git push --set-upstream origin ``` ``` $ git branch -d ``` > ``-D`` () ``` $ git push origin --delete $ git push origin -d $ git push origin : ``` ``` $ git remote prune origin ``` > remote ``` $ git branch --set-upstream origin/branch ``` ``` $ git checkout -b ``` ``git pull`` ``` # , origin/ $ git fetch origin # $ git difftool origin/ # $ git merge origin/ # mergetool $ git mergetool ``` ``master`` ``` $ git fetch origin master $ git difftool origin/master $ git merge origin/master $ git mergetool ``` ``` # A $ git cherry-pick # AB $ git cherry-pick # ABAAB $ git cherry-pick .. # ABAAB $ git cherry-pick ^.. ``` ``: ``` $ git branch -a --contains ``` ## ``` $ git tag ``` ``` $ git tag -a -m "tag message" # commit $ git tag -a -m "tag message" # commit ``` ``` $ git push origin # $ git push origin --tags # ``` ``` $ git tag -d # $ git push origin :refs/tags/ # ``` ## ``` $ git status ``` ``` $ git difftool $ git mergetool ``` ``` $ git log $ git log --pretty=oneline #commit id commit message ``` ``Tracked files`` ``` $ git checkout -- ``` ``Untracked files`` - n - f`Untracked` - d`Untracked` - x`gitignore``Untracked` ``` git clean -nfd ``` (`git add`) ``` $ git reset HEAD # filename ``` (`git commit`)(`git add`) ``` $ git reset --mixed HEAD^ # --mixed $ git reset HEAD^ ``` (`git commit`)(`git add`) ``` $ git reset --soft HEAD^ ``` (`git commit`)(`git add`)(``Untracked files``)`` ``` $ git reset --hard ``` > `HEAD```HEAD^````HEAD^^``100``HEAD~100`` ``commit id`` ``` $ git reflog ``` ``` $ git rm ``` ``push`` ``` $ git revert ``` > ``revert````commit````commit``;``reset````commit````push`` ## ``` $ git stash save "message" ``` : ``` $ git stash list ``` : ``` $ git stash pop [--index] [stash@{num}] or $ git stash apply [--index] [stash@{num}]# . ``` > ``--index``,``num``, : ``` $ git stash drop [stash@{num}] # $ git stash clear # ``` ## ### ``` $ git branch -d $ git tag -d $ git remote prune origin $ git pull ``` ### - `git` ``` $ git count-objects -v $ du -sh .git ``` - `ID` ``` $ git verify-pack -v .git/objects/pack/*.idx | sort -k 3 -n | tail -10 ``` > `ID``blob``tree`10 - `ID` ``` $ git rev-list --objects --all | grep "$(git verify-pack -v .git/objects/pack/*.idx | sort -k 3 -n | tail -10 | awk '{print$1}')" ``` - ``` $ git filter-branch --tree-filter 'rm -rf xxx' HEAD --all $ git pull ``` - `.git` ``` $ git gc --prune=now ``` > `push``git``gc``loose object` ### `Git`[](http://www.oschina.net/news/71365/git-annex-lfs-bigfiles-fat-media-bigstore-sym) ## ``git status````Untracked`` ### ``.gitignore`` ``` tmp/ # tmp *.ini # ini !data/ #data ``` > [``.gitignore``](https://github.com/github/gitignore) ### ``.gitignore_global````.gitignore````~/.gitconfig`` ``` [core] excludesfile = ~/.gitignore_global ``` `Tracked`,`Untracked`: ``` $ git rm -r --cached . ``` ## ### ``` $ git rebase -i [git-hash| head~n] $ git push -f # push merge ``` > `git-hash``rebase``commit``hash``head~n``HEAD``n``commit` ### ``` git filter-branch --commit-filter ' if [ "$GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL" = "xxx@localhost" ]; then GIT_AUTHOR_NAME="xxx"; GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL="xxx@example.com"; git commit-tree "$@"; else git commit-tree "$@"; fi' HEAD --all ``` ##
